title: AI Layoffs Surge in Tech Sector üìâ
full: Over 150,000 layoffs were recorded in October 2025 across major U.S. firms, many citing AI-driven automation as a reason. Analysts predict similar restructuring in 2026 as AI scales rapidly across departments.

title: Google Expands Gemini AI Capabilities üöÄ
full: Google has integrated its Gemini AI deeper into Workspace and Android. The new update allows contextual writing, live meeting summarization, and instant spreadsheet automation across devices.

title: OpenAI & AMD Announce Massive Compute Expansion ‚öôÔ∏è
full: OpenAI partnered with AMD to scale its AI infrastructure up to 6 GW compute capacity. This will drastically reduce latency for GPT models and enable more complex reasoning tasks.

title: MIT Warns of AI‚Äôs Growing Energy Use üå±
full: MIT researchers highlighted the carbon impact of training large AI models and urged cloud providers to switch to renewable energy. The report notes AI could consume 10x more electricity by 2030.

title: Australia Mandates Chatbot Safety Compliance üßí
full: Australia‚Äôs eSafety Commissioner has ordered chatbot developers to file safety and moderation reports. The rule targets child-safety and privacy for conversational AI tools.

title: Mozilla Tests AI-Powered Browser Features ‚ö†Ô∏è
full: Mozilla revealed it is testing an AI-native Firefox variant that summarizes pages, fills forms, and translates contextually ‚Äî all while preserving user privacy.

title: Google‚Äôs Visual AI Search Goes Global üîç
full: Users can now snap a photo and ask questions about it using Google's AI Search. The update merges Lens, Gemini, and Search into one unified multimodal experience.
